poem:
Title: "In American Winds"

Through turbulence of an electoral song,
Angst of divided hearts rung strong.
The unease, if I dare, echoes long,
Fault lines of a nation, deep-drawn.

Defining crises, elusive quest,
Root, remedy, tangled nest.
Traumas of past on the crest,
In discordance, we lay unrest.

Through the turmoil now we move,
Ghostly echoes, spirits prove,
Unity - the elusive groove,
In the American winds, we rove.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "American psyche: a new series exploring the angst at the heart of the US election The vibes, to put it lightly, are off. The 2024 election is proof that the country remains divided, with fault lines so deep that we struggle to collectively define the crises themselves, let alone what has caused them or what would offer solutions. Our current dissonance comes on the tail of past, enduring traumas which did nothing to bring us". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
